Item.setPlaybook: Drag a Playbook from the Compendium

AttributeDescription.Prowess: Consequences from physical strain or injury.
AttributeDescription.Resolve: Consequences from mental strain or willpower.

ActionDescription.Aim: When you Aim, you use poise, keen perception or sometimes patience to achieve precision. You might nail a pheasant with a crossbow, flick a pebble into a bucket to distract a foe, deliver a paralysing chop to a guard's pressure point or toss a grapple up to catch on a parapet (but Manoeuvre might be more appropriate)
ActionDescription.Command: When you Command, you compel and intimidate. You might threaten a servant to spill their master’s secrets, rally a mob of villagers to descend upon the witch’s hut, or rely on your air of authority to garner preferential treatment at the pub (but Persuade might be more appropriate)
ActionDescription.Devise: When you Devise, you fabricate a plan or construct. You might rig up traps, manufacture explosives, manipulate complex mechanisms, compose music or determine a secret point of entry from the ancient plans of a manor (but Study might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Doctor: When you Doctor, you use training and rationality to overcome cerebral challenges. You might try to staunch blood flowing from a wound, explain a phenomena to a perplexed noble, treat a fever, or analyse a fungus to develop an anti-toxin (but Study might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Evoke: When you Evoke, you employ words or symbols which have otherworldly power. You might instil acolytes with zealous fervour, summon forth the dead to reveal the manner of their sad demise, control and exploit your own hideous mutation, or perform a conjuration by reading an evil tome (but Study might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Fight: When you Fight, you employ martial skill in close quarters. You might try to put a knife through an enemy’s ribs, wrestle a pig, tie a struggling tax collector to a chair, or simply annihilate an opponent with a headbutt (but Wreck might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Manoeuvre: When you Manoeuvre, you perform or orchestrate a feat of physical prowess. You might give someone a boost over a cemetery wall, make a quick escape by sliding across a slippery rooftop, amaze a crowd with a juggling act or launch into combat on the end of a rope (but Fight might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Persuade: When you Persuade, you convince or win over with words and gestures. You might deploy flattery to change a truculent bargeman’s attitude, concoct an elaborate but compelling lie, or pressure a noble into giving them a magical heirloom (but Command might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Scout: When you Scout, you move warily and with stealth. You might infiltrate a bank vault unseen, stalk silently through woodland, or emerge from the shadows to subdue a guard (but Fight might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Study: When you Study, you probe, cogitate and analyse. You might spend time researching in the library, glean evidence from a pile of bones, practise the mannerisms of someone you intend to impersonate, or contemplate the scuff marks on a desk to pinpoint a secret switch (but Surveil might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Surveil: When you Surveil, you observe and interpret what can be seen and heard. You might watch a crowd for signs of trouble, examine the landscape for evidence of a creature’s passage, look for hidden traps or keep an eye on the road in anticipation of ambush (but Scout might be more appropriate).
ActionDescription.Wreck: When you Wreck, you wield force with destructive intent. You might charge a door with your shoulder to batter it down, cleave through the supports of a lookout tower, toss a wrench into the busy workings of a steam engine, or scuttle a boat with a bomb (but Devise might be more appropriate).

Experience.Title: Experience
Experience.HowItWorks: You earn an Experience point when...
Experience.DesperateRoll: You roll for an Action (or lead a Group Action) in a Desperate Position. You can only use this Experience to advance the Attribute encompassing that same Action.
Experience.Character: Youexpress your beliefs, drives or background. (max 2)
Experience.Vice: Took Action demonstrating your Erratic Behaviour, if you have one. (max 2)
Experience.Bruiser: Addressed a challenge with violence or coercion, successful or not.
Experience.Captain: Addressed a challenge with charm or authority, successful or not.
Experience.Keeper: Addressed a challenge with research or mysticism, successful or not.
Experience.Outrider: Addressed a challenge by reconnaissance or tracking, successful or not.
Experience.Sapper: Addressed a challenge with technical nous or craft, successful or not.

Teamwork.Title: Teamwork
Teamwork.Tips: Take someone else's consequensesLead a group actionAssist another player

OutfitAdvance.Title: Advance as you gain Agenda Points
OutfitAdvance.Placeholder1: Gain 1 agenda point which depend on outfit's playbook
OutfitAdvance.Placeholder2: Gain 2 agenda points which depend on outfit's playbook
OutfitAdvance.HowItWorks: Advance as you gain Agenda Points

Methods.One: 1 Agenda Point if you improved your cover as Hunters by slaying a monster.
Methods.Two: 1 Agenda Point if you acted in ways fitting for your Secret Agenda.
Methods.Three: 2 Agenda Point if you achieved something specific to bring your Secret Agenda closer to fulfilment.

ShowForPlayers.Title: Show
ShowForPlayers.Tooltip: Show this field in limited sheet

EffectDescription.Title: Effect
EffectDescription.Zero: This action has poor, little or even zero effect. 0 Tick
EffectDescription.Poor: You achieve a very weak effect. 1 Tick
EffectDescription.Limited: You achieve a partial or weak effect. 2 Tick
EffectDescription.Reasonable: You achieve what we’d expect as “normal” with this action. 3 Ticks
EffectDescription.Suberb: You achieve more than usual. 4 Ticks

BonusDescription.StrangersBargain: The Stranger’s Bargain applies regardles of success or failure.
BonusDescription.Assistance: Character who helps suffer 1 stress and might also suffer any consequences that occur because of the roll.

ManifestBehaviour.Title: Gain Erratic Behaviour
ManifestBehaviour.Description: You get {stress} stress, so manifest an Erratic Behaviour and cannot perform Actions that incur Stress until you have reduced Stress during an Aftermath phase.

Controlled.Mixed: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer minor injury, you end up in a risky position.
Controlled.Fail: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.

Risky.Mixed: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer injury, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
Risky.Fail: Things go badly. You suffer injury, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.

Desperate.Mixed: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer mortal injury, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
Desperate.Fail: It’s the worst outcome. You suffer mortal injury, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.

Resistance.Result: You reduce or avoid the effects of the consequence (GM chooses).

Wilderness.Critical: How do you shrug off the conditions?  What do you talk about on your journey?
Wilderness.Success:
How do you endure the conditions?

You have an encounter.
Wilderness.Mixed:
How do you suffer the conditions?

One player suffers a Hardship.

You have an encounter.
Wilderness.Fail:
You are lost.

How do you succumb to the conditions?

Add one tick to the Season Clock.

Two players suffer a Hardship.

You have an encounter.
Wilderness.Cautious: Take 1 Stress each to represent caution and prudence.
Wilderness.Forest: Are you travelling into the Great Voidal Forest?

WildernessDescription.Cautious: +1d (-1 Stress each) for extra caution and prudence.
WildernessDescription.Forest: -1d for travelling into the Great Voidal Forest.

Engagement.Critical: You have put initial obstacles behind you and are in a Controlled Position for what follows
Engagement.Success: You face the first obstacle in a Controlled Position
Engagement.Mixed: A complication places you in a Risky Position. Horrid things threaten to happen, but are not yet ruinous.
Engagement.Operation: Is this operation particularly bold or daring? Take +1d. Is this operation overly complex or contingent on many factors? Take -1d.

IndulgeVice.Regular: You indulge your vice. Clear {stress} stress.
IndulgeVice.Overindulgence: You overindulge. Clear all stress and choose an outcome:
IndulgeVice.Brag: • Go missing: Advance the Season Clock. Other players gain 1 extar Aftermath activity.
IndulgeVice.Offence: • Cause offense: Lose standing with a friendly Faction.
IndulgeVice.Succumb: • Succumb to the Vale: Gain a point of Corruption.

ImportActor.Title: Import actor
ImportActor.Description: Import an actor {actor} from the compendium?

Item.ExistsId: Item with the same id already exists in the container.
Item.ExistsName: Item with the same name already exists in the container.
Item.NotSupported: The {item} can't be added to this container.

Actor.ExistsId: Item with the same id already exists in the container.
Actor.ExistsName: Item with the same name already exists in the container.
Actor.InPack: You may only add Friends to the Character which exist in the World.
Actor.NotSupported: The {type} {actor} can't be added to this container.
